patterns_discovered: Concurrent read and write operation testing
Race condition detection for registry operations
Systematic test cases for different concurrent scenarios
gotchas_discovered: Potential race conditions in shared registry state
Need for precise synchronization in concurrent operations
Importance of checking exact number of successful/failed operations
Complexity of testing thread-safety across multiple operation types
discoveries.approach_outcome: Comprehensive thread-safety verification of registry operations with various concurrent access patterns
recommendations: Implement mutex or atomic operations in SessionRegistry implementation
Consider using sync.Map or more advanced synchronization primitives
Add timeouts to concurrent tests to prevent potential deadlocks
Potentially use race detector in Go to further validate thread-safety
